page.title: 06Houses
page.content: There are very few new houses in our area.Most of the houses are fairly old and near to the river.Many of them have been modernised inside but on the outside they have kept the same type of windows and doors so that they have retained their character.Some houses have still got walls made of cob.Cob is unbaked clay mixed with straw or stones.Cob walls are very thick. Builders are not allowed to use cob nowadays. Houses are very expensive to buy.It would cost at least Â£30,000 to buy a cottage at Burrowbridge.Most people borrow money from a Building Society or a bank which they repay over a period of up to 25 years.If you want to buy or sell a house you contact an Estate Agent whose job it is to advertise and sell property.
